comment: Smooth, not too hot. Subtle fruits.
Your basic bourbon with a little spice finish and light oak. I use it for Bourbon Bloody Mary’s.
Nose is bready and vanilla, palate is more of the same and finish is a little sharp and warm. Nothing too crazy happening here, more of a good old fashioned bourbon vs a slow sipper

A- overripe banana, spicy rye, peppery oak, marshmallow
P- burnt marshmallow, caramel, banana, spices
F- thin medium finish, spicy peppery oak tannins
A little smoother than the 1792 small batch I have, with a little less spice up front. A smoother sipper than its small batch counterpart in my opinion.

A good bourbon with some Rye spice. I am not sure what the mashbill is here, but I found the nose light and floral and the favour to be layered with nice spice. A bit young and not too much oak, but an enjoyable drink.

11/25/16 Purch in Bowling Green, KY @ Liquor Barn $25.99 + $1.50 = $26.49 w/tax

Cut bottle makes a great glass
Would make a perfect house bourbon. Not over the top, nothing negative. Just a basic bourbon
